tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Joined PGA TOUR Latinoamérica by finishing T17 at the Q-School played in Lima, Peru, in January… Made the cut in 13 of 17 starts, collecting 5 top-10s to finish No. 8 on the Order of Merit… Had a strong debut of three top-5s on his first four starts. Finished T3 at the season opening 68th Avianca Colombia Open, where he played on the last group on Sunday. After missing the cut at the Mazatlán Open, he finished solo fourth at the 84th Abierto OSDE del Centro, once again playing on the last group on Sunday. Finished T4 at the Lexus Panama Classic on his next start… Shot 66-66 on the weekend to finish solo third at the Mundo Maya Open in October and collected a T7 finish at the Lexus Peru Open, where he carded a season low 8-under 64 to share the lead in the opening round… Finished T58 at the Web.com Tour Q-School final stage to earn conditional status for the 2016 season.

2008: Won a Gateway Tour event for his first win as a pro at Anthem Golf & Country Club in Anthem, Arizona. Finished at 14-under 202, two shots better than runner-up Oscar Fraustro.

2006: Made the cut in 2 of 14 starts during his rookie season on the Web.com Tour… His best Web.com Tour finish was T33 at the Preferred Wichita Open in July… Missed the cut at the Chrysler Classic of Tucson on his first career start on the PGA TOUR.

2005: Earned Web.com Tour status in December after finishing T79 at the final stage of PGA TOUR Q-School.

OTHER DETAILS: Won the Waterloo Open, the largest and longest-running professional tournament in Iowa, in back-to-back years in 2010-11... Has won three times on the eGolf Gateway Tour, twice in 2011 and once in 2008.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played college golf at the University of Arizona, 2001-2005… Helped his team to the finals of the 2004 NCAA Championship by making a 35-foot putt on the final hole of regionals. Was named a 2005 honorable mention All-American… Named Nebraska Junior Amateur Golfer of the Year in 2000 and 2001.
tourBios.personal: Got his start in golf from his parents at the age of eight… Lost his parents and girlfriend in a tragic plane crash a few months before graduating from college… Worked as a real state agent after college and still does… Earned four letters in basketball and finished his career as the school's all-time leading scorer at Mitchell High School in Mitchell, Nebraska... An outstanding HS student, he was an Academic Letter Winner, won the United States National Mathematics Award and was a U.S. Army Scholar Athlete Award winner… Favorite courses he has played are Oakmont, Merion and Pumpkin Ridge… Never travels without books… “Old School” is his favorite movie… “Breaking Bad” is his favorite TV show… Steak and sushi are his top food choices… San Diego and New York are his favorite cities to visit… His father, Arnold Palmer and Tiger Woods would round out his dreamed foursome… His bucket list includes skydiving and traveling to Europe and Australia… Personal motto: “Live life as if it were your last day.”

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T58 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament

tourBios.personal: Earned all-state honors in basketball three times during his career at Mitchell High School in Nebraska...Got his start in golf from his parents at the age of eight...Lists playing in his first U.S. Amateur at Oakmont and making it to the final stage of the 2005 PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament as his biggest thrills in golf.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri in 2016 is T16th at the 69 Avianca Colombia Open presentado por BBVA.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 7th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Latinoamérica.
